choices.A: The heartbeat messages can be seen using the command diagnose debug authd fsso list.
choices.D: The heartbeat messages must be manually enabled on FortiGate.
choices.C: The heartbeat messages can be seen on FortiGate using the real-time FSSO debug.
choices.B: The heartbeat messages can be seen in the collector agent logs.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true regarding heartbeat messages sent from an FSSO collector agent to FortiGate? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Useful-FSSO-Commands/ta-p/195830
A is not correct because the command "diagnose debug authd fsso list" is specifically used to list current logons/users, not to view heartbeat messages.
Correct answer is BC.

Selected Answer: A
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Troubleshooting-Tip-FortiGate-session-table-information/ta-p/196988
correct answer is A

choices.D: It is an ICMP session from 10.1.10.1 to 10.200.5.1.
choices.B: Return traffic to the initiator is sent to 10.200.1.254.
choices.C: It is an ICMP session from 10.1.10.10 to 10.200.1.1.
choices.A: Return traffic to the initiator is sent to 10.1.0.1.
PPP chooses from a group of parallel options to identify the optimal path for processing a packet.
choices.B: Only FortiGate hardware configurations affect the path that a packet takes.
choices.D: Software configuration has no impact on PPP.
choices.C: PPP does not apply to packets that are part of an already established session.

questions.question_text: Which statement about parallel path processing is correct (PPP)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.4.0/parallel-path-processing-life-of-a-packet/364543/parallel-path-processing

Selected Answer: D
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4306
correct answer is D

questions.question_text: In IKEv2, which exchange establishes the first CHILD_SA?
Which statement about IKE and IKE NAT-T is true?

choices.A: IKE is used to encapsulate ESP traffic in some situations, and IKE NAT-T is used only when the local FortiGate is using NAT on the IPsec interface.
choices.C: They each use their own IP protocol number.
choices.D: They both use UDP as their transport protocol and the port number is configurable.
choices.B: IKE is the standard implementation for IKEv1 and IKE NAT-T is an extension added in IKEv2.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
IKE (Internet Key Exchange):
The protocol used to establish and manage security associations (SAs) for IPsec.   
Uses UDP as the transport protocol.
The port number for IKE is typically 500.   
Configurable to use different port numbers for security reasons.
IKE NAT-T (Network Address Translation Traversal):
An extension of IKE that allows IPsec to work correctly in environments where one or both endpoints are behind Network Address Translators (NATs).
Also uses UDP as the transport protocol.
Port number is configurable for IKE NAT-T as well, allowing flexibility in deployment scenarios.

Selected Answer: D
Tanto IKE como IKE NAT-T usan UDP como protocolo de transporte, y los n√∫meros de puerto son configurables en FortiGate (aunque los valores predeterminados son 500 para IKE y 4500 para NAT-T).
